{{Orphan|date=March 2013}}
'''Geohorizon''' is an annual technical symposium conducted by the [[Society of Geoinformatics Engineers]], a society organised by the undergraduate students studying [[Geoinformatics]] at [[College of Engineering, Guindy]]. It is one of the first Geospatial symposiums to be organized and held in India, conducted since 2005. "GeoHorizon" is one of the flagship events for the students in the geospatial domain. It provides a platform to showcase their talent and induce team spirit. It has a nationwide reach with industries and sponsorships that connects students of both undergraduate and graduate level.
For past thirteen editions, Geohorizon has been platform for young enthusiasts to explore the depths of the latest in Geospatial technology. It has broken myths, opened new avenues and redefined every perception of Geomatics.
Geohorizon is conducted every year in the early week of March. The moto of the symposium is to share the knowledge of [[geospatial]] technologies within the engineering students. The symposium extends for three days. Workshops,technical events ,fun events and guest lectures are conducted as part of the symposium.
== Geohorizon 2018 == [http://www.geohorizon.in/ GeoHorizon ′18]
==External links== *[http://www.annauniv.edu/sge Official website of the Society of Geoinformatics Engineers] *[https://web.archive.org/web/20071104085322/http://www.annauniv.edu/sge/spectra/ Official E-Journal of the Society of Geoinformatics Engineers] *[http://www.annauniv.edu/sge/geohorizon Official Website for GEOHORIZON' 09]
[[Category:Academic conferences]] [[Category:Geographic information systems]] [[Category:Science and technology in Tamil Nadu]]

{{Unreferenced|date=October 2017}}'''Henning Kronstam''' (June 29, 1934 – May 28, 1995) was a famous [[Denmark|Danish]] [[ballet]] [[dancer]], ballet master and company director.
Born in [[Copenhagen]], [[Denmark]], he began training with the [[Royal Danish Ballet]] at the age of nine. He later joined the company as an apprentice at the age of sixteen and was promoted to solo dancer at the age of twenty one.
Kronstam dominated the Royal Danish Ballet's repertory for more than two decades, dancing over 120 roles, many of which were created, such as the role of Romeo in Sir [[Frederick Ashton]]'s ''Romeo and Juliet'' (1955), the Husband in [[John Cranko]]'s Secrets (1956), Nilas in [[Birgit Cullberg]]'s ''Moon Reindeer'' (1958), and the Prince in [[Flemming Flindt]]'s '' The Nutcracker'' (1971).
He succeeded Flemming Flindt as ballet master of the [[Royal Danish Ballet]] in 1978 and was responsible for the planning and direction of the 1979 [[August Bournonville|Bournonville]] Festival as well as for restoring Bournonville, and classical ballet generally, to the center of the company's repertory. He also was a noted teacher and coach. He retired as balletmaster in 1985 but continued to stage and rehearse ballets until 1994. He died suddenly, May 28, 1995, of a pulmonary embolism.
==External links== *[http://www.bournonville.com/ bournonville.com] *[http://www.kronstam.com/ kronstam.com]
{{Authority control}}
{{DEFAULTSORT:Kronstam, Henning}} [[Category:Danish male ballet dancers]] [[Category:Ballet masters]] [[Category:1934 births]] [[Category:1995 deaths]] [[Category:Royal Danish Ballet dancers]]

{{Use dmy dates|date=August 2013}} {{Infobox video game |title= Hotel Giant |image= Maximum Capacity Hotel Giant cover.jpg |caption= |developer= [[Enlight Software]] |publisher= [[JoWood Productions]] |designer= |series= |engine= |released={{vgrelease|NA|May 17, 2002|EU|2002}} |genre= [[Business simulation game]] |modes= [[Single player]], [[multiplayer game|Multiplayer]] |platforms=[[Microsoft Windows|Windows]] }}
'''''Hotel Giant''''' ({{zh|s=模拟饭店|t=模擬飯店|p=Mó Nǐ Fàn Diàn}}), known in North America as '''''Maximum Capacity: Hotel Giant''''', is a [[business simulation game]] developed by [[Enlight Software]] and published by [[JoWood Productions]] for [[Microsoft Windows|Windows]]. The soundtrack was composed by [[Bjørn Lynne]].
==Overview== The play of the game involves developing and managing a hotel. The user starts with a pre-made building to which they add rooms, place useful and decorative objects in the rooms, and set up hotel details such as advertising. Once this has happened, the user opens up the hotel to the public and starts to run it as if it were a real business. It is similar to the "Tycoon" style of game ([[Railroad Tycoon]], [[RollerCoaster Tycoon]], [[Zoo Tycoon]], etc.), in which the player creates a system or establishment and then runs it.<ref>[http://www.mobygames.com/game/hotel-giant Hotel Giant at Moby Games]</ref> Hotel Giant 2 offers improved graphics, more features and a new campaign.
==Versions== There are currently three versions of Hotel Giant. These are: *Hotel Giant, released 14 May 2002 *Hotel Giant 2, released in UK on 21 November 2008<ref>[http://www.gamespot.com/pc/strategy/hotelgiantii/index.html Hotel Giant 2 at GameSpot]</ref> *Hotel Giant DS
==Reception== ''Hotel Giant'' received a "Gold" sales award from the [[Entertainment and Leisure Software Publishers Association]] (ELSPA),<ref name=goldelspa>{{cite web |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090319031650/http://www.elspa.com/?i=3943 |url=http://www.elspa.com:80/?i=3943 |title=ELSPA Sales Awards: Gold |work=[[Entertainment and Leisure Software Publishers Association]] |archivedate=19 March 2009 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref> indicating sales of at least 200,000 copies in the United Kingdom.<ref name=gamasutrasales>{{cite web|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170918063107/https://www.gamasutra.com/view/news/112220/ELSPA_Wii_Fit_Mario_Kart_Reach_Diamond_Status_In_UK.php |url=https://www.gamasutra.com/view/news/112220/ELSPA_Wii_Fit_Mario_Kart_Reach_Diamond_Status_In_UK.php |title=ELSPA: ''Wii Fit'', ''Mario Kart'' Reach Diamond Status In UK | author=Caoili, Eric | date=November 26, 2008 |work=[[Gamasutra]] |archivedate=September 18, 2017 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref>
The game received a fairly poor reception, with a [[Metacritic]] average of 54%. D+PAD said that any pros were "outweighed by some of the cons, most notably the repetitive and the non-engaging nature of the gameplay."<ref>http://www.dpadmagazine.com/2009/02/10/hotel-giant-2 D+PAD</ref> IT Reviews commented that the game "wasn't much fun" and you'd get "more amusement with an old, second hand copy of [[Sim Tower]]".<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.itreviews.co.uk/games/g543.htm |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2009-11-18 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090328120723/http://www.itreviews.co.uk/games/g543.htm |archivedate=28 March 2009 |df=dmy-all }} IT Reviews</ref>
==References== <references/>
==External links== *{{moby game|id=/hotel-giant|name=''Maximum Capacity: Hotel Giant''}} {{Enlight}}
[[Category:Business simulation games]] [[Category:Video games developed in the People's Republic of China]] [[Category:Windows games]] [[Category:Windows-only games]] [[Category:2002 video games]]

revision.text:
'''Institutional pedagogy''' is a practice of [[education]] that is centered on two factors: 1. the complexity of the learner, and the "[[Unconscious mind|unconscious]]" that he or she brings to the classroom. This unconscious is another name for the diversity of social, economic, cultural and other unspoken elements that an educator interacts with in an institutional setting; and 2. the role of the institution in the process of intervening in both those psycho-social factors and in what is known by a student.
But even more than this, as conceived by its founder, [[Fernand Oury]], Institutional Pedagogy is a constant calling into question of the institutional context itself. Thus the classroom is never a presupposed and static setting. The movement of Institutional Pedagody is thus in direct opposition to the prevailing trends of education prior to the late 1960s, almost all of which tended to homogenize socio-cultural differences amongst learners, psycho-social factors in learning and most important the presence of the "unconscious" in the classroom itself.
Thus the use of '[[institution]]' in Institutional Pedagogy is broader than in its more colloquial sense. To Oury the institution could be defined as:
''"the places, moments, status of each according to his/her level of performance, that is to say according to his/her potentialities, the functions (services, posts, responsibilities), roles (president, secretary), diverse meetings (team captains, different levels of classes, etc.), and the rituals that maintain their efficacy."''
==Bibliography==
*Oury, Fernand and Aïda Vasquez. Vers une pédagogie institutionnelle. Paris: [[Maspero]], 1968.
*[[Félix Guattari]], “L’intervention institutionnelle.” (Paris: Payot [Petite Bibliothèque n. 382], 1980).
*René LAFFITTE, Groupe TFPI, Mémento de Pédagogie Institutionnelle - Faire de la classe un milieu éducatif, Matrice, 1999 *Jacques PAIN, Pédagogie institutionnelle et formation, MICROPOLIS, 1982 *Jacques PAIN, La pédagogie institutionnelle d'intervention, Matrice PI, 1993 *Françoise THÉBAUDIN, Fernand OURY, P. I. - Mise en place et pratique des institutions dans la classe, Matrice, 1996
== See also == *[[Popular education]]
[[Category:Pedagogy]] [[Category:Popular education]] [[Category:Alternative education]] [[Category:Philosophy of education]] [[Category:Educational psychology]]

'''The International Congress of Maritime Museums''' is an international network of [[maritime museums]], associations, and individuals devoted to maritime preservation. It publishes a newsletter and convenes biennial congresses.

{{ Infobox scientist | name = Janice E. Cuny | other_names = Jan | image = | image_size = 200px | caption = Jan Cuny | birth_date = | birth_place = | death_date = | death_place = | nationality = American | fields = [[Computer Science]] | workplaces = [[National Science Foundation]]
[[Purdue University]]
[[University of Massachusetts]]
[[University of Oregon]] | alma_mater = [[University of Michigan]] | doctoral_advisor = | doctoral_students = | known_for = Broadening participation in computing | awards = SIGCSE Award for Outstanding Contributions to Computer Science Education }} '''Janice E. Cuny''', known as '''Jan''', is an American [[computer scientist]] noted for leading efforts in broadening participation in computing. She is a past co-chair of [[CRA-W: Committee on the Status of Women in Computing Research]] from 1997-2000. == Biography == Cuny received a [[Doctor of Philosophy|Ph.D]] in [[Computer Science]] from the [[University of Michigan]]. She was a faculty member in the Department of Computer Science at [[Purdue University]] from 1981-1983; then a faculty member at the [[University of Massachusetts]], and then at the [[University of Oregon]]. In 2004, she became a program officer at the [[National Science Foundation]] heading the Broadening Participation in Computing Initiative, the CS 10K project and in 2016 leading the STEM + Computing Partnerships initiative. == Awards == In 2015, she received the 2016 [[SIGCSE]] Award for Outstanding Contributions to Computer Science Education. {{cite web |author= SIGCSE |url= http://sigcse.org/sigcse/ |title=SIGCSE 2016 Award Winners |publisher= SIGCSE |accessdate= 2016-01-30 }} Her other notable awards include: * 2014 Richard Tapia Achievement Award {{cite web |author= Marketwired |url= http://www.marketwired.com/press-release/dr-jan-cuny-receives-2014-richard-tapia-achievement-award-1882834.htm |title=Dr. Jan Cuny Receives 2014 Richard Tapia Achievement Award |publisher= MarketWired |date= 2014-02-26 |accessdate= 2016-01-30 }} * 2009 [[Woman of Vision Social Impact ABIE Award]] from the [[Anita Borg Institute]].{{cite web|url=https://anitaborg.org/profiles/abie-award-winners/social-impact/janice-e-cuny/|title=Janice E. Cuny - AnitaB.org|date=1 October 2009|website=anitaborg.org}}{{cite web|url=https://anitaborg.org/awards-grants/abie-awards/|title=Abie Awards - AnitaB.org|website=anitaborg.org}} * 2007 CRA A. Nico Habermann Award {{cite web |author= University of Oregon Computer and Information Science |url= https://www.cs.uoregon.edu/News/20070330-Cuny.php |title=Prof. Jan Cuny Earns Habermann Award for Leadership |publisher= www.cs.uore |date= 2014-02-26 |accessdate= 2016-01-30 }} * 2003 Presidential Award for Excellence in Science, Mathematics and Engineering Mentoring (PAESMEM) - for CRA-W {{cite web |author= National Science Foundation |url= https://www.nsf.gov/news/news_summ.jsp?cntn_id=100381 |title=President Bush Honors Excellence in Science, Mathematics and Engineering Mentoring |publisher= nsf.org |date= 2004-05-06 |accessdate= 2016-01-30 }} ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== National Science Foundation: [https://www.nsf.gov/mobile/staff/staff_bio.jsp?lan=jcuny&org=NSF&from_org= Janice Cuny, Program Officer] {{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Cuny, Janice}} [[Category:Women computer scientists]] [[Category:University of Massachusetts faculty]] [[Category:University of Oregon faculty]] [[Category:Purdue University faculty]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:University of Michigan alumni]] [[Category:Year of birth missing (living people)]] [[Category:Computer science educators]]

{{multiple issues| {{notability|Web|date=November 2012}} {{update|date=November 2012}} }} '''JournalReview.org''' is an online interdisciplinary [[journal club]].<ref name="americantelemed">[http://www.americantelemed.org/conf/2006/concurrentsessions2.htm Asynchronous International Journal Club, A Working Model] {{Webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140221121844/http://www.americantelemed.org/conf/2006/concurrentsessions2.htm |date=2014-02-21 }} by Jeffrey I. Ellis, MD, Lori Ellis, Adam Penstein, MD, Aryeh Goldsmith. Eleventh Annual Meeting & Exposition of the American Telemedicine Association May 7–10, 2006</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.atmeda.org/news/2006_presentations/w1d1.ppt|title=Asynchronous International Journal Club, A Working Model|work=American Telemedicine Association Presentation Slides|accessdate=Feb 10, 2008}}{{Dead link|date=July 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}</ref><ref>"A new model for an on-line journal club," American Academy of Ophthalmology, Las Vegas, 2006</ref><ref>"Journal club, the past, present, and future," Dermatologic Society of Greater New York, NY 2006</ref> It hosts an international community of doctors and exists for the purpose of facilitating critical discussion and [[post-publication peer review]] of all [[medical literature]] indexed by the [[United States National Library of Medicine|National Library of Medicine]] in [[PubMed]].<ref>{{cite journal|url=http://www.retrovirology.com/content/3/1/55|doi=10.1186/1742-4690-3-55|title=Beyond open access: open discourse, the next great equalizer|author=Dayton, A. I.|journal=[[Retrovirology (journal)|Retrovirology]]|year=2006|volume=3|pages=55|pmid=17007632|issue=1|pmc=1569436}}</ref><ref>"A new model for evidence based medicine," Advances in Medical and Cosmetic Dermatology, Hawaii 2006</ref> It is part of the movement towards [[open peer review]],<ref>[http://www.mednetcongress.org/ocs/schedule.php Open Peer Review Of The Medical Literature] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20080113203035/http://www.mednetcongress.org/ocs/schedule.php |date=2008-01-13 }} MEDNET Conference, 2006</ref><ref>[http://www.mednetcongress.org/ocs/schedule.php Is the eRevolution in biomedical publication moving forward or back?] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20080113203035/http://www.mednetcongress.org/ocs/schedule.php |date=2008-01-13 }} MEDNET Conference, 2006</ref> [[telemedicine]],<ref name="americantelemed" /><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.isft.net/cms/picture/upload/incorporate_journalreview_into_your_journal_club.pdf|title=The International Society for Telemedicine & eHealth|accessdate=Feb 26, 2008|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20081118110057/http://www.isft.net/cms/picture/upload/incorporate_journalreview_into_your_journal_club.pdf|archivedate=2008-11-18|df=}}</ref> and [[self-archiving]]/[[Open access (publishing)|open access]].<ref>{{cite journal|url=http://www.eblue.org/article/S0190-9622(08)00906-7/pdf|title=Self-archiving dermatology articles|author1=Robert P. Dellavalle |author2=Marcus A. Banks |author3=Jeffrey I. Ellis |journal=JAAD|year=2008|volume=59|pages=1086–1088}}</ref>
== Contents == It is [[world wide web|web]]-based and consists of commentary and discussion related to published [[medical literature]].<ref name="americantelemed" />
Members can participate individually, or by creating their own "[[journal club]]s"<ref>{{cite journal|doi=10.1016/j.athoracsur.2005.03.106|url=http://journalreview.org/v2/articles/view/16181849.html|title=Prevalence of gastroesophageal reflux in end-stage lung disease candidates for lung transplant|first9=G|last10=Keshavjee|first10=Shaf|last9=Darling|first8=L|last8=Miller|first7=M|last7=Hutcheon|first6=M|last6=De Perrot|first5=TK|last5=Waddell|first4=A|last4=Pierre|first3=D|last3=Hadjiliadis|first2=LG|last2=Singer|author=D'Ovidio F|journal=Ann Thorac Surg|year=2005|volume=80|pages=1254–60|issue=4|pmid=16181849|display-authors=8}}</ref><ref>{{cite journal|doi=10.1056/NEJMoa055218|url=http://journalreview.org/v2/articles/view/16481635.html|title=Calcium plus vitamin D supplementation and the risk of fractures|first9=HR|last10=Blanchette|first10=Patricia|last11=Bonds|first11=Denise E.|last12=Brunner|first12=Robert L.|last13=Brzyski|first13=Robert G.|last14=Caan|first14=Bette|last15=Cauley|first15=Jane A.|last16=Chlebowski|first16=Rowan T.|last17=Cummings|first17=Steven R.|last18=Granek|first18=Iris|last19=Hays|first19=Jennifer|last20=Heiss|first20=Gerardo|last21=Hendrix|first21=Susan L.|last22=Howard|first22=Barbara V.|last23=Hsia|first23=Judith|last24=Hubbell|first24=F. Allan|last25=Johnson|first25=Karen C.|last26=Judd|first26=Howard|last27=Kotchen|first27=Jane Morley|last28=Kuller|first28=Lewis H.|last29=Langer|first29=Robert D.|last30=Lasser|first30=Norman L.|last9=Black|first8=SA|last8=Beresford|first7=T|last7=Bassford|first6=CE|last6=Lewis|first5=J|last5=Robbins|first4=RB|last4=Wallace|first3=M|last3=Gass|first2=AZ|last2=Lacroix|author=Jackson RD|journal=N Engl J Med|year=2006|volume=354|pages=669–83|issue=7|pmid=16481635|display-authors=8}}</ref> – collections of members who are actively participating in discussion of mutual interest. Some residency training programs have adopted this resource to meet [[ACGME]] requirements.<ref>[http://www.acgme.org/acWebsite/resInfo/ri_webLinks.asp ACGME Residency Resources] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20060613070701/http://www.acgme.org/acWebsite/resInfo/ri_webLinks.asp |date=2006-06-13 }}</ref> Members have utilized this resource to suggest future research,<ref>{{cite journal|doi=10.1016/j.jaad.2005.06.031|url=http://journalreview.org/v2/articles/view/16310083.html|title=Lack of efficacy of topical latanoprost in the treatment of eyebrow alopecia areata|first4=J|last4=Shapiro|first3=H|last3=Lui|first2=C|last2=Bolduc|author=Ross EK|journal=J Am Acad Dermatol|year=2005|volume=53| pages=1095–6|issue=6|pmid=16310083}}</ref><ref>{{cite journal|url=http://journalreview.org/v2/articles/view/15530312.html|title=Audiovisual presentations in peer-reviewed medical literature|first3=KC|last3=Smith|first2=SL|last2=Comite|author=Huntley A|journal=Dermatol Online J|volume=10| pages=22|issue=2|year=2004|pmid=15530312}}</ref> and to identify [[bias]] or limitations to published work.<ref>{{cite journal|doi=10.1016/j.jaad.2005.07.028|url=http://journalreview.org/v2/articles/view/16243128.html|title=A randomized controlled trial assessing the efficacy of fluconazole in the treatment of pediatric tinea capitis|first5=BE|last5=Elewski|first4=MA|last4=Ghannoum|first3=H|last3=Panzer|first2=SF|last2=Friedlander|author=Foster KW|journal=J Am Acad Dermatol|year=2005|volume=53|pages=798–809|issue=5|pmid=16243128}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://jpscanlan.com/images/ORAL_ANNOTATED.pdf|title=Measurement Problems in the National Healthcare Disparities Report|author=James P. Scanlan|accessdate=Feb 10, 2008}}</ref> Educators have utilized this resource to help stimulate and document critical discussion of assigned journal articles.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://southmed.usouthal.edu/library/classes/bbl480/0319handout.pdf|title=University of South Alabama Biomedical Library, Lesson Plans|accessdate=Feb 10, 2008|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20081201173328/http://southmed.usouthal.edu/library/classes/bbl480/0319handout.pdf|archive-date=December 1, 2008|dead-url=yes|df=mdy-all}}</ref> Authors have utilized this resource to answer questions about and provide supplement to their published work.<ref>{{cite journal|doi=10.1111/j.1365-2133.2005.06459.x|url=http://journalreview.org/v2/articles/view/15787813.html|title=Monitoring patients on methotrexate: hepatic fibrosis not seen in patients with normal serum assays of aminoterminal peptide of type III procollagen|first6=DJ|last6=Stott|first5=JK|last5=Schofield|first4=F|last4=Tatnall|first3=CA|last3=Green|first2=AJ|last2=Maddox|author=Maurice PD|journal=Br J Dermatol|year=2005|volume=152|pages=451–8|issue=3|pmid=15787813}}</ref><ref>{{cite journal|doi =10.1001/archderm.142.3.337|url =http://journalreview.org/v2/articles/view/16549709.html|title=Trends in malpractice premiums for dermatologists: results of a national survey|author=Resneck JS|journal=Arch Dermatol|year=2006|volume=142|pages=337–40|issue=3|pmid =16549709}}</ref> This resource has also been utilized by the public as a vehicle to better understand published trade literature.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.autismcincy.org/parents'guidetoresearch10.20.07.ppt|title=A Parent's Guide to Autism Research|author=Cynthia A. Molloy, MD, MS|accessdate=Feb 10, 2008}}</ref>
Members consists of all the [[Medical specialties|major specialties]] as well areas of basic science. Approximately 7,000 doctors, health care professionals, researchers, residency training programs, and students from all over the world participate. It is listed as a recommended resources by the [[New York Public Library]],<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.nypl.org/links/index.cfm?Trg=1&d1=194&d3=Magazine%20and%20Journal%20Articles|title=New York Public Library|accessdate=Feb 10, 2008}}</ref> the [[Dalhousie University]] College of Pharmacy,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://dir.pharmacy.dal.ca/journals.php|title=Dalhousie University College of Pharmacy, Useful Journals in Pharmacy|accessdate=Feb 10, 2008}}</ref> the [[State University of New York]] Downstate Medical Library,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://library.downstate.edu/resources/ebm.htm#tut|title=State University of New York Downstate Medical Library|accessdate=Feb 10, 2008}}</ref> as well as several other related websites.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://dhd10.org/hcproinfo.html|title=District Health Department|accessdate=Feb 10, 2008|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080415020308/http://dhd10.org/hcproinfo.html|archivedate=2008-04-15|df=}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.hi.is/~joner/eaps/pubmed1.htm|title=PubMed Tutorial from the Sigillum Universitatis Islandiae|accessdate=Feb 10, 2008}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.cbil.vcu.edu/mac/pubs/macmessages/113/macmessages113.pdf|title=Mid Atlantic Chapter of the Medical Library Association|accessdate=Feb 10, 2008|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20060503035741/http://www.cbil.vcu.edu/mac/pubs/macmessages/113/macmessages113.pdf|archivedate=2006-05-03|df=}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://fmignet.aafp.org/PreBuilt/fmig_2006_casewestern.pdf|title=Case Western Reserve University Family Medicine Interest Group|accessdate=Feb 10, 2008}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.uchsc.edu/som/news/2006ff.pdf|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070209173635/http://www.uchsc.edu/som/news/2006ff.pdf|dead-url=yes|archive-date=February 9, 2007|title=University of Colorado School of Medicine|accessdate=Feb 10, 2008}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://dermatologyreview.org/sunyweb/|title=State University of New York, Department of Dermatology|accessdate=Feb 10, 2008}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://davidrothman.net/wp-content/uploads/2007/12/3rd-pary-pubmed-handout-5-page.doc|title=VCU Libraries Other PubMed Search Engines|accessdate=Feb 11, 2008}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.utmem.edu/Medicine/urology/manual/Journal_Web_Sites.DOC|title=The University of Tennessee Health Science Center|accessdate=Feb 11, 2008}}{{dead link|date=December 2017 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}</ref>
